QuestionJSON.Question: Starshine has just finished designing a mobile game that's fun and educational. However, they’ve received feedback from some users that they're struggling to navigate through the game due to color blindness. Starshine realizes that they need to increase the accessibility of the game for all users. What can Starshine do to make the game more accessible to color-blind users?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Starshine can change the color scheme of the game to bright neon colors.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Starshine can add patterns or textures in addition to color to distinguish game elements.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Starshine can add more levels to the game to divert attention from color issues.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Starshine can write a disclaimer in the game description warning color-blind users of potential navigation difficulties.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Adding additional visual cues such as patterns or textures can supplement color differentiation, making elements distinguishable to color-blind users. This increases accessibility by ensuring that everyone, regardless of their vision, can navigate and enjoy the game.
